prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. 1. Draw a 2D sketch on a new coordinate system with the given translation vector and euler angles. 2. Create a rectangle on the X-Y plane using the following vertices as the corner points: (0, 0), (2, 0), (2, 4), (0, 4). This forms the base of the prism. 3. Move the rectangle 6 units along the Z-axis to create the top of the prism. 4. Scale the sketch by 0.1332 to match the desired dimensions. Part 2: Construct a tapered cylindrical top Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. It has a smooth surface and appears to be a solid, three-dimensional shape. 1. Draw a 2D sketch on a new coordinate system with the given translation vector and euler angles. 2. Create a circle on the X-Y plane using the following point as the center and radius: (0.0612, 0.0612), 0.0612. 3. Extrude the circle by 0.1332 units in the Z-direction. 4. Scale the sketch by 0.1225 to match the desired dimensions. 5. Join the cylindrical top with previous part (part 1) to form a single solid body. Part 3: Construct a square frustum Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. 1. Draw a 2D sketch on a new coordinate system with the given translation vector and euler angles. 2. Create a square on the X-Y plane using the following vertices as the corner points: (0, 0), (0.0933, 0), (0.0933, 0.0933), (0, 0.0933). This forms the base of the frustum. 3. Extrude the square by 0.187 units in the Z-direction. 4. Scale the sketch by 0.0933 to match the desired dimensions. 5. Join the square frustum with previous part (part 2) to form a single solid body. After completing these steps, you will have constructed a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom, as described in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.6168,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.1289,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.1289,0.0],"End Point":[0.1289,0.1332]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.1289,0.1332],"End Point":[0.1042,0.1332]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.1042,0.1332],"End Point":[0.0247,0.1332]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.0247,0.1332],"End Point":[0.0,0.1332]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.1332],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.4298,"sketch_scale":0.1332,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.6168,0.0032,0.0054]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.0612,0.0612],"Radius":0.0612}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1332,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.1225,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}},"part_3":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.187,0.1111,0.02]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.0933,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.0933,0.0],"End Point":[0.0933,0.0933]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0933,0.0933],"End Point":[0.0,0.0933]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0933],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.187,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.0933,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. This will position the sketch for the first part of the assembly. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. Start by drawing a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. This forms the bottom edge of the prism. Continue by drawing a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.625]. This forms the left edge of the prism. Next, draw a line from point [0.75, 0.625] to point [0.0434, 0.6308]. This forms the back edge of the prism. Then, draw a line from point [0.0434, 0.6308] to point [0.0, 0.6308]. This forms the top edge of the prism. Finally, connect the top edge to the starting point by drawing a line from point [0.0, 0.6308] to point [0.0, 0.0]. This completes the sketch for the first part, which is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by applying the 3D rotation defined by the Euler angles and the translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.5 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The sketch scale factor is 0.75. This completes the first part of the CAD assembly. The length of this part is 0.75, the width is 0.5, and the height is 0.75. The final shape of this part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front and back faces are parallel to each other, while the left and right faces are perpendicular to the front and back faces. The top and bottom faces are also parallel to each other. The object is centered in the image.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape Description Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a curved surface. The object has a rectangular base and a slightly tapered cylindrical body. The top and bottom surfaces are parallel to each other. Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. Generate Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Create Faces and Loops Divide the sketch into two faces: a rectangular base (face_1) and a curved top surface (face_2). Face 1: Rectangular Base On face_1, create a loop (loop_1) consisting of a single circle (circle_1) with a center at (0.3409, 0.3409) and a radius of 0.3409. Face 2: Curved Top Surface On face_2, create a loop (loop_1) made of 4 arcs. 1. Arc 1: Start Point at (0.2731, 0.675), Mid Point at (0.3409, 0.75), End Point at (0.4087, 0.675). 2. Arc 2: Start Point at (0.4087, 0.675), Mid Point at (0.3975, 0.6771), End Point at (0.3863, 0.6788). 3. Arc 3: Start Point at (0.3863, 0.6788), Mid Point at (0.3409, 0.7273), End Point at (0.2956, 0.6788). 4. Arc 4: Start Point at (0.2956, 0.6788), Mid Point at (0.2843, 0.6771), End Point at (0.2731, 0.675). Scale Sketch Scale the entire sketch up by a factor of 0.75. Extrude Sketch Extrude the scaled sketch upwards by 0.0909 units and create a new solid body. This completes the construction of part 1 with the specified dimensions: - Height: 0.0909 - Width: 0.75 - Length: 0.75</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a triangular base, centered on the white background. The base of the prism is angled at 45 degrees. The height of the prism is approximately twice the width. The width of the prism is approximately the same as the height of the prism. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and translation vector of 0.0, 0.028, 0.0. 2. Switch to the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw lines to create a rectangle in the XY plane with a width of 0.75 and a height of 0.028. * Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] * End Point: [0.75, 0.0] * Start Point: [0.75, 0.0] * End Point: [0.75, 0.1681] * Start Point: [0.75, 0.1681] * End Point: [0.0, 0.1681] * Start Point: [0.0, 0.1681] * End Point: [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Extrude the sketch by 0.014 towards the normal and 0.014 in the opposite direction of the normal. Part 2 Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and translation vector of 0.1897, 0.028, 0.0421. 2. Switch to the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle in the XY plane with a center at [0.0132, 0.0419] and a radius of 0.0132. 4. Draw a circle in the XY plane with a center at [0.4721, 0.0419] and a radius of 0.0419. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.514. 6. Extrude the sketch by 0.1924 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal. Part 3 Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center, slightly tilted to the right. The hole is also cylindrical and is located in the center of the object. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector of 0.1368, 0.0148, 0.084. 2. Switch to the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle in the XY plane with a center at [0.0132, 0.0132] and a radius of 0.0132. 4. Draw a circle in the XY plane with a center at [0.4632, 0.0132] and a radius of 0.0132. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4765. 6. Extrude the sketch by 0.0 in the direction of the normal and 0.1324 in the opposite direction of the normal.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom** **2D Sketch** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.1733] 2. Draw the first face of the sketch on the XY plane. 3. Create a circle (circle\\_1) at the center coordinates [0.0767, 0.0767] with a radius of 0.0767. **Extrusion** 1. Extrude the circle along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.5 units towards the normal and 0.0 depth towards the opposite normal. 2. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.1533. **Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** **2D Sketch** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0767, 0.25, 0.0] 2. Draw the first face of the sketch on the XY plane. 3. Create a circle (circle\\_1) at the center coordinates [0.25, 0.25] with a radius of 0.25. **Extrusion** 1. Extrude the circle along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.0383 units towards both the normal and the opposite normal. 2. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.5. The final shape is a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a stylized cone. It has a flat base and a narrower top. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. The dimensions of the final shape are length: 0.1533, width: 0.5, and height: 0.2753. The first part has a length: 0.1533, width: 0.1533, and height: 0.1533. The second part has a length: 0.0766, width: 0.5, and height: 0.0766. These instructions will help a junior CAD designer create an accurate CAD model.</description>
